context.p: Serna allows editing very large documents by collapsing portions of them. Serna estimates the size of a document on opening it in WYSIWYG mode. Large documents are treated according to the user's preferences: open either normally or collapsed.
You can specify the rules of handling large documents:

info.p: To call up the Preferences Dialog, choose Tools Preferences .

step.cmd: Set what document should be considered large.

info.p: To set what document should be considered large, specify the number of pages in the Treat document as large if it takes more than ... pages spinner on the Folding pane.

step.cmd: Set the rule of handling a large document.

info.p: To set the rule of handling a large document on opening, select a radio button on the When opening large document pane:

choices.choice: To open a large document collapsed, select the Always open with some elements collapsed radio button.
To ask the user whether to collapse a large document or not, select the Ask user radio button.
To open a large document without collapsing, select the Do not collapse radio button.

step.cmd: Click the Apply button to apply the settings.
Click the Close button to close the dialog.
